Lachipora Wildlife Sanctuary9. Tattakuti National Park10. Nandini Wildlife SanctuaryTravel Tips for Visiting National Parks in Kashmir Join our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Curious about what paradise is? National Parks in Kashmir bring you on stage in the presence of nature's biggest drama! These parks aren't merely havens in nature but windows to adventures that perhaps you would have only hoped for. Trust us, after reaching here, you'll be kicking yourself over having taken so much time in doing so.Looking for places to visit in Kashmir? Start with Dachigam, where you can spot hangul deer feeding through foggy meadows. Or go for Hemis, where fortune can smile on you with a catch of the elusive snow leopard. And the plus point? There are just so many things to do in Kashmir - from camping under star-studded skies more lovely than you could have ever dreamed of to trekking through meadow-floored wildflowers.If you are a wildlife photographer or a nature lover, National Parks in Kashmir are sure to leave you amazed. Searching for your own Kashmir dream? Our Kashmir Tour Packages can help you uncover these gems without losing any of the magic. Come and see why people call Kashmir heaven on earth!The Top 10 National Parks In Kashmir1. Dachigam National ParkImage Source : Wildlifesos”Dachigam National Park is in the Himalayan folds as a radiant example of Kashmir's wildlife retreats. Dachigam's Kashmiri name is etymological and refers to its age since it means "ten villages" in Kashmiri. Each Kashmiri tour requires tourists to visit this wilderness retreat as it lies in proximity to all Kashmiri hotels.Dachigam stands as one of the most desired National Parks in Kashmir because it maintains local populations of endangered Hangul deer and evasive Snow Leopards. The magical green pastures alongside thick woodland create an atmosphere like the famous "The Jungle Book" which brings natural enchantment to life. This park is one of the best Wildlife sanctuaries in Kashmir.Plan your Kashmir tour carefully to include Dachigam National Park because it promises enchanted beauty in its wonderful sanctuary landscape. Read moreBest Time To Visit: June to AugustTimings: 8 AM to 6 PM2. Hemis National ParkImage Source : ThetimesofIndia”Hemis National Park of the majestic Himalayas invites nature lovers and explorers to witness its natural beauty within the range. At the center of Ladakh stands this mystical park that goes by the name “Hidden Kingdom” as it remains the best national parks in Jammu and Kashmir's hidden treasures among national parks. Bombay film directors have discovered its stunning beauty, so it now stands ready to serve both as a Kashmir honeymoon destination and summer break destination.The 4400 square kilometer stretch of Hemis National Park offers a sanctuary for wildlife explorers. The land of Hemis National Park contains an extensive collection of animals that includes the rare species of snow leopard, Tibetan wolf, and Himalayan marmot. Hemis National Park maintains an ecosystem suitable for Golden Eagle and Lammergeier bird species along with other bird species. It is one of the best wildlife parks in Kashmir. Read MoreLocation: Leh, Jammu And KashmirBest Time To Visit: June to SeptemberTimings: Open on all daysEntry Fees: INR 20 (Indian Nationals) and INR 100 (Foreigners)Suggested Read: Bhimgarh Fort, Kashmir3. Kazinag National ParkImage Source : Frontline-thehindu”The stunning Kazinag National Park provides travelers with a perfect blend of natural beauty and outdoor adventure located in the center of Jammu and Kashmir. The untouched natural world is as hard to find as the most unexpected plot turns in Bollywood movies.Kazinag National Park, one of the jewels of national parks in Jammu and Kashmir, covers a total area of 362 square kilometers. Fairyland at Kazinag covers Himalayan terrain and wide grasslands that make it a fascinating destination.While traveling through these Kashmir Wildlife Sanctuaries keep your eye out for hangul deer since this creature symbolizes Kashmir's wildlife heritage. Congratulations are due for spotting the resplendent Markhor while sighting the snow leopard is the ultimate highlight of these mountains.The wildlife's natural beauty and stunning scenery make Kazinag National Park comparable to the most exciting Indian cinematic experiences. Prepare yourself for a real Kashmiri welcome to fully appreciate the beauty known as "Chon Kasheer" (the beauty of Kashmir).Location: Baramulla district, Jammu And KashmirBest Time To Visit: May to SeptemberTimings: Open throughout the daySuggested Read: Valleys In Kashmir4. Kishtwar National ParkImage Source : Wikipedia”As one of the premier national parks in Kashmir, Kishtwar National Park in Jammu and Kashmir's scenic district stands out among all other parks in the region. Its mystical terrains attract comparison to Indian film moments thus appealing to both wildlife admirers along with Bollywood followers to explore the site. The local name "Kishtwar Amaaz" describes this park as a sanctuary that provides natural beauty combined with serenity to visitors.All wild animals of Kishtwar National Park find refuge within its 400 square miles of protected land. Wildlife conservation is symbolized through the rare snow leopard sightings that could potentially occur for lucky park visitors. Additionally to its supreme predator, the park cares for Himalayan brown bears along with musk deer and colorful red foxes. The park presents a beautiful setting for your adventure through its stunning green meadows and pure streams, which match the thrilling landscapes audiences recognize from films such as “Bajrangi Bhaijaan” and “Haider.” Read MoreLocation: Forest Block, Kishtwar district, Jammu And KashmirBest Time To Visit: February to OctoberTimings: Open throughout the dayEntry Fees- Nil5. Salim Ali National ParkImage Source : Aryango”The Kashmir Wildlife Sanctuaries showcase Salim Ali National Park as “Salim Ali Bagh,” which exists as a distinctive treasure in its beautiful Jammu and Kashmir locations. This national parks in Kashmir holds prime status among Kashmir's natural parks since it functions as a quiet haven for adventure guests along with wildlife admirers while serving all types of nature enthusiasts. The park stretches over both forested areas and grassy meadows to present visitors with a complete experience of Kashmir's wonderful wildlife and calm natural landscapes.The collection of animals at Salim Ali National Park includes the Hangul deer together with leopards and musk deer as well as several species of birds. The park exists beyond its park status because it supports animal communities as well as human spirituality. Trust these Kashmir travel tips because they guide guests to explore Salim Ali National Park, where natural wonders await exploration. “Kus naavo!” (Come and see!) Read MoreLocation: Srinagar, Kishtwar district, Jammu And KashmirBest Time To Visit: April to OctoberTimings: Open throughout the dayEntry Fees- INR 10 (Indian Nationals) and INR 100 ( Foreign Nationals)Suggested Read: Top Places for Shopping in Gurez Valley6. Overa-Aru Wildlife SanctuaryOvera-Aru Wildlife Sanctuary, situated near Pahalgam, is one of the best wildlife parks in Kashmir for birdwatchers. It has over 100 bird species and breathtaking meadows and is one of the top places to visit in Kashmir. It also shelters leopards, red foxes, and deer, making it a must-visit Kashmir National Park.Best Time to Visit: June to SeptemberThings to Do: Wildlife spotting, trekking7. Hirpora Wildlife SanctuaryThe Kashmir region hosts the Hirpora Wildlife Sanctuary, which exists as a wildlife sanctuary in Kashmir within the Shopian district. This sanctuary hosts both Markhor and leopards, musk deer, and Himalayan black bears, among its other species. Nature enthusiasts will find the sanctuary extremely appealing because it features dense forests together with wide grasslands and refreshing mountain breezes. You must experience the Hirapora Lake trek while visiting this park.Birdwatchers will find this area suitable because various bird species live in the location. The natural habitat of flora and fauna of Kashmir becomes visible to visitors as they walk through peaceful paths. People who seek sanctuary in Kashmir wildlife tourism can enjoy this location because it does not experience heavy visitor traffic. This park is one of the best Wildlife sanctuaries in Kashmir.Best Time to Visit: May to OctoberThings to Do: Wildlife spotting, nature photographySuggested Read: Snowfall in Kashmir8. Lachipora Wildlife SanctuaryLachipora Wildlife Sanctuary is a quiet wildlife sanctuary in Kashmir, located in Baramulla district. It is home to the rare Markhor, a wild goat that lives in the mountains. Other animals like leopards, deer, and black bears also live here. The sanctuary has green forests, rivers, and hills, making it a beautiful place to visit. People can go for walks, watch birds, and enjoy nature. Since it is not very crowded, it is perfect for those who love peace. It is also an important place for Kashmir wildlife tourism, as many animals and birds can be seen here.Best Time to Visit: March to OctoberThings to Do: Wildlife safaris in Kashmir, birdwatching9. Tattakuti National ParkTattakuti National Park is a beautiful national park in Kashmir, located in the Pir Panjal mountains. It has thick forests, green meadows, and clear lakes. Many animals like black bears, leopards, and deer live here. The park is great for trekking and enjoying nature. Bird lovers can see many different birds. It is a quiet and peaceful place, perfect for people who want to relax away from busy tourist spots. The park is also home to many plants and flowers, making it a great spot to explore the flora and fauna of Kashmir in a calm, natural setting.Best Time to Visit: April to JuneThings to Do: Trekking, camping10. Nandini Wildlife SanctuaryNandini Wildlife Sanctuary is a peaceful wildlife sanctuary in Kashmir, located near Jammu. It is best known for its many bird species, making it a great spot for birdwatching. The sanctuary also has leopards, wild boars, and deer living in its thick forests. The fresh air, green hills, and quiet surroundings make it a relaxing place for nature lovers. People can enjoy nature walks and see different animals and birds in their natural home. Since it is less crowded, it is perfect for those who love peace and wildlife. It is an important part of Kashmir National Parks Travel Guide.Best Time to Visit: October to April, when wildlife is most active.Things to Do: Birdwatching, wildlife spotting, nature walks, and photography.Suggested Read: Waterfall in KashmirTravel Tips for Visiting National Parks in Kashmir Do follow our Kashmir Travel Guide for a breezy travel.1. The best time to visit national parks in Kashmir is April to October for pleasant weather and active wildlife. For snow leopards, visit during winter (Nov to Feb).2. Bring trekking shoes suitable for walking, warm clothes for high-altitude parks, and pack rain gear during monsoon months.3. Move quietly, avoid disturbing wildlife, and refrain from littering to preserve the environment.4. Certain parks charge entry permits, so plan and bring proof of valid ID.5. Take a local guide for an enhanced experience and stick to established trails to prevent getting lost.6. Bring water, snacks, binoculars, a camera, and essential medical essentials for a comfortable visit.7. For those who love adventure, go on the best trekking routes in Kashmir national parks with adequate equipment and planning.8. Spend nights in eco-lodges or hotels nearby and book transport in advance since some parks are located in far-flung places.9. Plan according to the weather forecast and avoid going during heavy snowfall or torrential rains.10. Obey park rules, do not feed wildlife, and leave nothing behind to help maintain Kashmir nature reserves.Following these travel tips will ensure a safe and enjoyable experience while exploring the national parks in Kashmir.Get exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience.
